thread.title: I Wish I Were Larry David's Cool Daughter Cazzie
thread.title_full: I Wish I Were Larry David's Cool Daughter Cazzie

title: I Wish I Were Larry David's Cool Daughter Cazzie

persons.name: queens jogger karina vetrano chelsea peretti

organizations.name: abortion ban bill advances to state senate
emergency cool-kid shortage threatening the globe
fat-flushing workout huffpost women  pussy riot

text:
Cazzie David‚Äôs Instagram. Photo: Courtesy of Instagram/cazziedavid Lifestyle content is all about aspiration, which is code for making people envy you and shop accordingly. In our series I Like This Bitch‚Äôs Life , the Cut bitterly admits that it‚Äôs working. 

Here‚Äôs what I know about Cazzie David, the 23-year-old daughter of Larry and ex-wife Laurie David.
Her name is Cazzie, which as far as I know is not short for anything (her younger sister‚Äôs name is Romy, also not short for anything). She is, obviously, richer than God. She has a vintage Seinfeld jacket that she sometimes wears out, and she doesn‚Äôt care if people think it‚Äôs lame (as she captioned the picture: ‚Äúwearing this in public idgaf‚Äù). She generally doesn‚Äôt G an F about stuff, which she demonstrates by posing for ‚Äúugly‚Äù selfies, or writing comments without any capitalization: ‚Äújc jc‚Äù ‚Äúpic I took‚Äù ‚Äúwe rly don‚Äôt care‚Äù or simply the word ‚ÄúOK.‚Äù She has all the trappings of a Gone Girl ‚Äìstyle millennial cool girl, but with an added layer of self-awareness. As she explained in a guide to Instagramming she wrote for Vanity Fair : ‚ÄúWe all know captions can make or break a photo. Like Hemingway once did, I try to restrain myself to six words. These captions show how ‚Äòlittle thought‚Äô went into posting the photo, even though a ton of thought went into it because you are following these rules.‚Äù Cazzie David is funny ‚Äî of course she is ‚Äî she‚Äôs Larry David‚Äôs daughter.

Wearing this in public idgaf 
A photo posted by CAZZIE (@cazziedavid) on Mar 26, 2016 at 5:01pm PDT 
Idfwu 
A photo posted by CAZZIE (@cazziedavid) on Oct 3, 2014 at 12:18pm PDT 
Other fun facts: Cazzie‚Äôs favorite meal is breakfast, and her favorite food is waffles. Her other favorite foods are s‚Äômores and charcuterie platters. She has the best possible combination of pets: a goldendoodle and rare domestic cat, one of the ones that look like a small leopard, possibly a Savannah cat or a Bengal. Neither of them appears to be a rescue.
Last name ever first name greatest 
A photo posted by CAZZIE (@cazziedavid) on Aug 29, 2015 at 1:06pm PDT 
Back up lil bitch 
A photo posted by CAZZIE (@cazziedavid) on Feb 16, 2016 at 11:16am PST 
Cazzie likes to swim, preferably in aquamarine golf course pools or in pristine beaches in tropical resort towns. When she‚Äôs not wearing a bathing suit, she‚Äôs generally wearing pajamas, or some form of loose-fitting yet beautifully made loungewear. This preference is so well-established that she even has a monogrammed pair of pajamas that says ‚ÄúCazzie David only wears pajamas.‚Äù Every bed and couch she lies on appears to be insanely comfortable: L-couches the size of school buses, hammocks covered in fur, voluptuous oversize beds with the shape and density of marshmallows. 

24 hour champagne diet 
A photo posted by CAZZIE (@cazziedavid) on Jun 3, 2014 at 5:07pm PDT 
Coconuts erryday 
A photo posted by CAZZIE (@cazziedavid) on Mar 11, 2015 at 2:51pm PDT 
!! 
A photo posted by CAZZIE (@cazziedavid) on Aug 21, 2015 at 4:39pm PDT 
Are there hard things about being the daughter of the world‚Äôs most famous neurotic ? I bet. Does Larry sometimes take her and her friends out for waffles, and then Larry gets mad about some perceived slight by one of the waitstaff and storms out of the restaurant, leaving Cazzie to have to apologize to her friends and surrounding onlookers for her dad‚Äôs outburst? Definitely. Did some of Larry‚Äôs anxieties get passed on? Likely so, and they‚Äôll be great fodder for a memoir or semi-autobiographical sitcom pilot later in life. Does Cazzie have an expensive therapist to work through these issues? Probably, but she‚Äôs 23, so she‚Äôs still on her parents‚Äô health insurance. Plus, there are some demonstrable perks to being the daughter of comedy royalty. Cazzie David gets to go to SNL whenever she wants. She gets front-row tickets to Justin Bieber concerts and Knicks games. She goes to the Oscars and the Vanity Fair after-party. She gets to borrow stuff from her dad‚Äôs chic normcore wardrobe . Sometimes, they go on fun father-daughter outings together, like touring all the Civil War battlefields. Do you know how much people would pay to have Larry David tour them around all the Civil War battlefields? Cazzie gets to do that for free whenever she wants.
He's making us tour every civil war battlefield 
A photo posted by CAZZIE (@cazziedavid) on Sep 26, 2015 at 11:23am PDT 
Ya boy Bernie 
A photo posted by CAZZIE (@cazziedavid) on Nov 8, 2015 at 8:56am PST 
Cazzie occupies the center of an enviable Venn diagram: hot millennials and celebrity daughters, two pillars of aspirational lifestyle content. But while I have spent more than a few hours scrolling through the feeds of an Alexis Ren or a Kylie Jenner, Cazzie has a certain personable, down-to-earth vibe that sets her apart from your average Instagram heiress. In the realm of quirky, neurotic Jewish girls who love comedy, Cazzie represents the platonic ideal, the kind of person you‚Äôd cast in an idealized movie version of your own life. She‚Äôs perfected an aesthetic that my younger self strove for: ironic, simultaneously high-strung and laid-back, subtly bookish while also being cartoonishly hot, blessed with a charcoal-hair-and-green-eyed combo that I thought only existed among designer Labradoodles and Disney princesses. By all metrics, I should hate Cazzie David. But I don‚Äôt. Gazing upon her feed, scrolling through picture after picture of lavish breakfast platters and elite photo-booth selfies , I have to admit: Oy vey , I like this bitch‚Äôs life.
As I mentioned, a lot of Cazzie‚Äôs appeal comes from being self-aware. As she also wrote in her Vanity Fair Instagram opus : ‚ÄúYou want to have the perfect balance of hot and funny on your Instagram, but you never want too much of either ‚Ä¶ Don‚Äôt try to add humility to your blatant ‚Äòhot‚Äô posts through a half-hearted attempt at being funny. You look good, just own it.‚Äù You know what? Amen . Who among us wouldn‚Äôt like to own it like this bitch does?

Woe 
A photo posted by CAZZIE (@cazziedavid) on May 31, 2015 at 3:17pm PDT 
In the few interviews she has given, Cazzie has relatably described herself as ‚Äúthe most anxious, least chill person ever.‚Äù In no way do I want to underplay how hard it is to live with anxiety; I know that no matter how cool you look, your inner landscape doesn‚Äôt always match the outside, and no number of poolside charcuterie platters can calm the turbulence within. But frankly, this knowledge only makes me like this bitch‚Äôs life more. In times of duress, you can imagine her choosing to pop a Xanax (which Cazzie, inspired by the rapper Future , calls ‚Äúxanny‚Äù).
Perpetually in bed 
A photo posted by CAZZIE (@cazziedavid) on Oct 17, 2014 at 8:49pm PDT 
This hood is my home now 
A photo posted by CAZZIE (@cazziedavid) on Jan 30, 2017 at 6:22pm PST 
Cazzie has a serious boyfriend, SNL ‚Äôs youngest cast member and resident hot guy Pete Davidson. Pete has many tattoos, at least one of which he allegedly got for Cazzie. Here‚Äôs what Pete told People magazine when asked for a comment on their relationship: ‚Äò‚ÄúI just love her very, very much.‚Äù He could have said ‚Äúno comment,‚Äù but that‚Äôs what he said. Cazzie and Pete seem like one of those couples who are super fun to be around, and yet the intensity of their connection means you‚Äôll always feel just a little bit left out, like they‚Äôre always sharing in some inside joke you just can‚Äôt crack. I bet they spend a lot of their time together ‚Äúdoing bits‚Äù and making wry callbacks to earlier conversations.
Who wouldn't want to party w this super fun kooky couple 
A photo posted by CAZZIE (@cazziedavid) on Jan 2, 2017 at 3:47pm PST 
üê≥ 
A photo posted by CAZZIE (@cazziedavid) on Jul 8, 2016 at 11:28am PDT 
While I feel a bit weird coveting the life of a celebrity heiress, I console myself with the fact that Cazzie seems to have a good head on her shoulders. She recently graduated from Emerson. She phone-banked for Hillary. She idolizes Amal Clooney. Much like her mom, an environmentalist who produced An Inconvenient Truth and its sequel, Cazzie cares about the fate of the planet. She went to the Women‚Äôs March ( the one at Sundance, but whatevs ). Here‚Äôs what Cazzie said in an interview, when asked about politics: ‚ÄúThe election result has left me deeply disturbed as it has untold millions. Every aspect of it is hard to fathom but I‚Äôve been trying to read as much as I can about it to stay informed so I can act diligently and accordingly. There is so much at stake so there has never been a more important time to be engaged as a citizen, except for obviously before the election ‚Ä¶‚Äù

Yass Mom yaassss march 
A photo posted by CAZZIE (@cazziedavid) on Jan 21, 2017 at 12:04pm PST 
Annoying the shit out of AZ, PA, CO democrats #VOTE4HRC 
A photo posted by CAZZIE (@cazziedavid) on Nov 7, 2016 at 6:23pm PST 
Of course, being a celebrity kid isn‚Äôt a privilege you can coast on forever; being the daughter-of-so-and-so is a descriptor that becomes less and less glamorous with each passing year. But for a while, in that sweet spot between adolescence and adulthood, what could be better? The bliss of the celebrity child ‚Äî particularly one with a ‚Äúcool‚Äù parent in a covetable industry ‚Äî is that you have access to all the awesome things about adult success without actually having had to earn them yourself. And perhaps this is what I like most about this bitch‚Äôs life: not the waffle platters or the swimming pools, the goldendoodles or the lavish parties, but the sense of possibility that comes from having every opportunity at your fingertips ‚Äî old enough to make the most of it but still young enough to enjoy it.

It was a rough week 
A photo posted by CAZZIE (@cazziedavid) on Dec 6, 2012 at 3:08pm PST 
Nope 
A photo posted by CAZZIE (@cazziedavid) on Sep 15, 2013 at 12:11pm PDT
